alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:32AM EDT until May 02 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Oxford and Androscoggin Counties. Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Sagadahoc and Androscoggin Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Warner River at Davisville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Although no structures are affected, water inundates recreational areas in Warner and Davisville. The river is at bankfull in other reaches, some erosion may occur. At 8.0 feet, Riverside Road floods along with increasing depths over recreational fields in Warner. At 8.5 feet, Properties along Tom`s Pond including Pine Lane in Warner are flooded with water overtopping retention walls. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 7.9 feet this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 8.1 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage again late this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
